solution_line_template: If Flying Scotsman had {flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich} more carriages than Norwich, and Norwich had {norwich_carriages} carriages, then Flying Scotsman had {norwich_carriages} + {flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich} = <<{flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich}+{norwich_carriages}={flying_scotsman_carriages}>>{flying_scotsman_carriages} carriages.

Together, Flying Scotsman and Norwich had {flying_scotsman_carriages} +{norwich_carriages} = <<{flying_scotsman_carriages}+{norwich_carriages}={flying_scotsman_norwich_total}>>{flying_scotsman_norwich_total} carriages.

If Euston had {euston_carriages} carriages, {euston_more_than_norfolk} more carriages than Norfolk, Norfolk had {euston_carriages} - {euston_more_than_norfolk} = <<{euston_carriages}-{euston_more_than_norfolk}={norfolk_carriages}>>{norfolk_carriages} carriages.
Together, Euston and Norfolk had {norfolk_carriages} + {euston_carriages} = <<{norfolk_carriages}+{euston_carriages}={euston_norfolk_total}>>{euston_norfolk_total} carriages.

Altogether, Euston, Norfolk, Norwich, and Flying Scotsman had {euston_norfolk_total} + {flying_scotsman_norwich_total} = <<{euston_norfolk_total}+{flying_scotsman_norwich_total}={total_carriages}>>{total_carriages} carriages.
